text: One of the many messages of Passover is hope over hardship. May Jewish communities around the country and around the world find joy this Passover—even though this year’s celebrations may look and feel very different. Chag Sameach.

@senatemajldr has just “hotlined” a unanimous consent agreement to introduce,call up & pass,by voice vote,a bill to provide an additional $250 billion for #PPP. Any Senator objecting is asked to do so by noon today. 

Hope for the best

Farm workers have always been essential, and it's long past time they received the protections they deserve. That includes ensuring these workers who put food on our tables have access to COVID-19 testing, treatment, and so much more. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/02/us/coronavirus-undocumented-immigrant-farmworkers-agriculture.html

1/2 IMPORTANT #PPP UPDATE FOR LENDERS

Our bill assigned PPP a risk weight of zero %

Working with @FDICgov to provide lenders concrete regulations VERY SOON making clear #PPPloans will NOT increase the measured risk of your balance sheet & trigger additional capital requirements

Today I announced I'm calling for the suspension of credit card interest fees and penalties until this pandemic is over. Folks need relief and they need it now. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EVGYNKtXgAQsVxM.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1247944885623283712/vid/320x320/eRyMwCbtqKu34V8T.mp4?tag=13

I'm calling for an immediate suspension of credit card interest, fees, and penalties for the duration of this crisis.

No one should profit off of Americans who have just lost their income. Charging exorbitant interest, fees, and penalties during this pandemic is simply immoral.

For-profit colleges already suck down enough taxpayer dollars to load students up with debt for useless degrees. If one penny of federal relief money goes to these companies, it should be aid for students – not to boost profits for executives & investors. https://finance.yahoo.com/news/coronavirus-for-profit-colleges-130013431.html

I want to congratulate Senator @BernieSanders on running a strong campaign that has inspired a movement. 

It is my hope that together we can build on the progress we've accomplished #ForThePeople and defeat the current occupant of the White House. -NP

TUNE IN: About to virtually join @TheView at 11 a.m. ET to discuss the coronavirus crisis and what Congress can do to further help laid-off workers, communities, and struggling families who aren’t sure how they’ll make ends meet.

Our health system is stretched to the brink. People of color are affected at disproportionate rates. Unemployment is approaching Depression-era levels. The scale of this crisis demands we do much more, much faster. The next round of policymaking must address these hard realities.

Good analysis here. We need to be having this discussion.

Congress needs to act swiftly to fix the problems with this program and eliminate the cap on the total amount of money to keep workers employed. The government should guarantee that every small business that qualifies will get the help they desperately need—full stop.

The confusing process of applying for PPP puts an extra, unnecessary burden on small business owners. Even if they’re able to apply, some big banks have shut out small businesses from being able to receive these loans altogether.
https://www.vox.com/2020/4/7/21209584/paycheck-protection-program-banks-access

Frontline workers are putting their lives on the line to keep America functioning. Congress must embrace an Essential Workers Bill of Rights including paid leave, guaranteed safety protections, hazard pay, & protected collective bargaining rights for essential workers.
That fight does not end today. We’ll continue it together in the Senate and keep working to hold the wealthy and well-connected accountable to the people.

#COVID19 can be a death sentence for the ~2 million people in state & local prisons & jails. For people who started screeching when I named environmental racism+COVID:

Black + Brown communities have long been treated as dump yards. Trucking + waste sites spike respiratory & other disease.

The Bronx already had some of the highest asthma rates in the US. Wishing you and yours a happy Passover. Whether you’re celebrating over video chat or in person with those you’re staying at home with, let us all use this moment to remember that hope can be renewed even in the darkest of times.

Small business owners are panicked that there isn’t enough money to go around. Raising the cap is a start – but it won’t be enough. Every small business that qualifies should get the help they need, period. We should provide an absolute guarantee.

We need to suspend consumer debt collection. We need a true moratorium on evictions and foreclosures. We need to cancel student loan debt. We need to keep child care providers afloat and increase Social Security benefits.

If anyone has any doubts about what needs to be done, just ask some small business owners. Millions of them have been put through hell over the past two weeks as they scrambled to try to get access to the money they desperately need.

Small business owners are pleading for help—but the Payment Protection Program created to help America’s small businesses stay afloat and keep their workers on payroll has been nothing but a fiasco since its launch.

This is NOT accurate. 

The issue was not that banks are giving preference to their customers. The issue was that one bank was denying their own customers if they didn’t have a loan or credit card with them. 

Fortunately, they have changed this.
